intro: Isoloma bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá isoloma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branching. Isoloma bogotense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
